boardgame.name: Holland _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;44: Operation Market-Garden
boardgame.description: Holland '44, Operation Market-Garden, September 1944 is a two-player game depicting the Allies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; combined ground and airborne attack in the Netherlands during WWII, which was code named Operation Market-Garden._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game starts with the airborne landings on September 17th and continues until September 23rd. The Allied player must rush his ground forces forward as fast as possible to relieve his beleaguered airborne divisions and capture a bridge across the Rhine._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The scale of the map is 2 kilometers per hex and covers the battlefield from the Belgian border to Arnhem. The map also includes the area where the British 8th Corps fought on the right flank of 30th Corps._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Most units in Holland _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;44 are battalions, but units range from Company to Brigades._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Holland '44 uses a system very similar to Ardennes '44. It is basically a simple move-fight, I-go then u-go game. If you have played Ardennes '44 or Normandy '44 you will have no trouble learning the game. Rules such as ZOC Bonds, Determined Defense, Extended Movement, and Traffic Markers all make their reappearance. Due to the terrain of the Netherlands, special attention was given to river crossings, bridge building, and fighting in the flat polder terrain._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Scale:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Turn: 3 turns per day (AM, PM _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Night)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Hex: 1.24 miles / 2 kilometers_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Units: Company to Brigade_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Inventory:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 22 x 34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; full color map_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 17 x 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; full color map (together = 22 x 43.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Two dual-side printed countersheet (468 9/16_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; counters)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 40-page Holland '44 rulebook_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Two dual-side printed Player Aid cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One single-side printed Setup Card_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Two 6-sided dice_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Solitaire Playability: High_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Complexity Level: Medium-High_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players: 2 or more_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Playing Time: 4-15 hours_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Never played the game, just skimmed the rulebook. All components in mint condition, one of the counter sheets still unpunched. Note: the unpunched counter sheet is slightly miscut. All information on counters is fully visible, but you might not be able to clip the corners. I have contacted GMT and was told that all copies of the game have this problem. I was sent a replacement sheet (included with the game) but it has the same problem. Also, pictures show counters stored in a tray but I am selling the game without the tray itself. Counters will come in baggies. Shipping costs to mainland UK: £7
